bug.short_desc: Browser's Back button doesn't goes back between anchors on the same page

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: 1. Search for some function 2. Select some result and jump into by line anchor 3. Click on the function on that line which switch you on the place where it is defined 4. Let's assume that it is the same file 5. Now, click on Back button in your browser
Expected result: You stay on the line by function anchor, after browser Back, page is back on line anchor.
Actual result: First Back action - nothing happens. Second Back action - you are back on search result
You can try to use attached file by opening sample.cpp#68 and then by clicking on function().
Seems Windows affected only using IE7/FF3.6. I'm not able to reproduce it on Mac.
Used software: OpenGrok 0.10-rc, Apache Tomcat 6.0.29, Sun Java 6 1.6.0_20-b02, Debian GNU/Linux 5.0, IE
